bug.short_desc: Virtual list's getSelectables() return all items, regardless of whether they're selectable

long_desc.thetext: There should be a delegate for this, so that one needn't subclass the list, just to override _getSelectables().
I'm not sure if I get it right. Is the reason you need the delegate to fix a bug (as described in the title) that the getSelectables method is returning something wrong?

No, sry. I should've described it in more detail.
In a non-virtual list, you can just set the list-items selectable. But a virtual list is model-driven, so you can't do that. That's why the implementation of _getSelectables just returns the whole model:
https://github.com/qooxdoo/qooxdoo/blob/eeaa6e7/framework/source/class/qx/ui/list/List.js#L478
If you have some items, which shouldn't be selectable, you have to subclass the list and override _getSelectables.
It would be nice if the list would either
1. take the selectable property of the items into account, so that one can bind a model property to that item property in bindItem delegate or 2. support another delegate for this.
Meanwhile I'd prefer solution one, because it'd be the same mechanism as with the non-virtual list.
Thanks for the details. I think solution 1 is a good idea and we should add that.
